column1: Weighted MRI size (256, 256, 1) in T2, exposing the head of a man of 37 years old, of coronal section n°26 starting from the back of the skull. The image notably reveals the presence of: the white matter of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 1510.8398 mm³, the cortex of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 3944.5312 mm³, the left lateral ventricle of volume 22.4121 mm³, the white matter of left hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 208.3008 mm³, the left cerebellar cortex of volume 2619.5801 mm³, the white matter of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 1466.0156 mm³, the cortex of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 3899.7070 mm³, the white matter of right hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 245.2148 mm³ and the right cerebellar cortex of volume 2477.1973 mm³.

MRI size (256, 256, 1) in weighting T2, illustrating the head of a man of 37 years old of coronal section. The observation focuses on slice n°26 from the back of the skull. We observe the following characteristics: the white matter of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 1510.8398 mm³, the cortex of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 3944.5312 mm³, the left lateral ventricle of volume 22.4121 mm³, the white matter of left hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 208.3008 mm³, the left cerebellar cortex of volume 2619.5801 mm³, the white matter of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 1466.0156 mm³, the cortex of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 3899.7070 mm³, the white matter of right hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 245.2148 mm³ and the right cerebellar cortex of volume 2477.1973 mm³.
